2304400.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304400
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 001
2304400.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Allah is pleased with you about three things and He is angry with you about three things. He is pleased that you worship Him, not associating anything with Him, that you all take hold of the rope of Allah and that you give good counsel to those that Allah has put in authority over you. He dislikes you engaging in chitchat, asking a lot of questions and squandering wealth."

2304410.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304410
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 002
2304410.text: In commenting on the words of Allah Almighty, "Anything you spend will be replaced by Him. and He is the best of Providers," (34:39) Ibn 'Abbas said, "without extravagance or parsimony."

2304420.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304420
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 003
2304420.text: Abu'l-'Ubaydayn said, "I asked 'Abdullah about those who squander and he said, 'They are those who spend incorrectly.'"

2304430.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304430
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 004
2304430.text: Ibn 'Abbas said that he said that "the squanderers" were those who wasted money incorrectly.

2304440.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304440
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 005
2304440.text: Zayd ibn Aslam reported from his father that 'Umar used to say on the minbar, "O people! Improve your homes but be careful about these house snakes [which are a form of jinn] before they make you afraid. Those among them which are Muslim will not be clear to you and, by Allah, we have not made peace with them since the time when we treated them as an enemy."

2304450.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304450
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 006
2304450.text: Khabbab said, "A man is rewarded for everything except building."

2304460.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304460
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 007
2304460.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr was heard to say to a nephew of his who had left al-Waht, "Are your workers at work?" "I don't know," he replied. He said, "If you were clever, you would work as your workers work." Then he turned towards us and said, "When a man works with his workers in his house (and Abu 'Asim once said, 'in his property'), he is one of the workers of Allah Almighty."

2304470.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304470
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 008
2304470.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The Final Hour will not come until people compete with one another in the height of their buildings."

2304480.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304480
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 009
2304480.text: Al-Hasan said, "I used to go into the houses of the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, during the khalifate of 'Uthman ibn 'Affan, and I could touch their ceilings with my own hand."

2304490.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304490
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 010
2304490.text: Dawud ibn Qays said, "I saw that the rooms were made from the stumps of palm trees covered on the outside with smoothed hair. I think that the width of the house from the door of the room to the door of the house was about six or seven spans. The width of the room inside was ten spans. I think that the ceiling was between seven and eight, or there about. I stopped at the door of 'A'isha, which was facing the west."

2304500.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304500
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 011
2304500.text: "Do not make your buildings tall. That will come about in the worst of your days."'"

2304510.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304510
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 012
2304510.text: It is reported that Habba ibn Khalid and Sawa' ibn Khalid came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was repairing a wall - or a building - of his, and they helped him.

2304520.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304520
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 013
2304520.text: Qays ibn Abi Hazm said, "We went to visit Khubbab after he had been cauterised seven times. He said, 'Our Companions who came before us have gone and this world did not cause the, loss. We have been struck by an affliction for which we find no place to put it down except the earth. If it were no that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade us to pray for death, we would pray for it.'"

2304530.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304530
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 014
2304530.text: He continued, "Then we came to him another time while he was building a wall and his and he said, 'The Muslim is rewarded for everything on which he spends money except for what he spends on dust.'

2304540.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304540
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 015
2304540.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went by while I was repairing a hut I owned. He said, 'What is this?' I replied, 'I am mending my hut, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.' He said, 'The business is too swift for that.'"

2304550.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304550
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 016
2304550.text: Nafi' ibn al-Harith reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Part of a man's happiness is a spacious dwelling, a good neighbour, and a good mount."

2304560.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304560
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 017
2304560.text: Thabit reported that he was with Anas in a corner above one of his rooms. He said, "We heard the adhan and he came down and I came down as well. He took short stops and said, 'I was with Zayd ibn Thabit and I walked with him in this fashion. He said, "Do you know why I did it to you? The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, walked in this manner and he said, 'Do you know why I walked with you?' I replied, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'So that there would be a greater number of steps in search of the prayer.'"'"

2304580.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304580
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 019
2304580.text: Warrad, the scribe of al-Mughira ibn Shu'ba, said, "Mu'awiya wrote to al-Mughira, saying, 'Write down for me what you heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say.' So he wrote to him, 'The Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say at the end of every prayer, "There is no god but Allah alone with no partner. His is the Kingdom and His is the praise and He has power over everything. O Allah, none can withhold what You give nor can anyone give what You withhold. Nor will the wealth of someone with wealth help him against You.' He also write to him, 'He forbade gossip, asking too many questions, and wasting money. He forbade disobeying mothers, burying daughters alive, and he forbade asking people (without real need).'"

2304590.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2304590
In-book reference  : Book 25, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 25, Hadith 020
2304590.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "None of you will be saved by his actions?" "Not even you, Messenger of Allah?" they asked. "Not even me," he replied, "unless Allah covers me with mercy from Him. But act correctly and wisely and worship in the morning and evening and during part of the night. Keep to a middle path and you will arrive."
